}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== {{See also|Broadcom reference design}}
*[[Broadcom BCM94398 FCREF7X7]] • [[Broadcom]] [https://www.broadcom.com/products/wireless/wireless-lan-bluetooth/bcm4398 BCM4398] • 802.11be (Wi-Fi 7) :Model: BCM94398FCREF7X7 • FCC ID: QDS-BRCM1096 (2022-12-02) :802.11be WLAN PCI-E Custom Combination Card • ''Airgain'' N60AGAUA :EHT320, 4K-QAM, MLO, WFA, Frequency Range: 6105.0 - 6905.0 MHz <!-- Test - WLAN AP: Broadcom BCM67263
Wi-Fi 7 and dual-core Bluetooth combo chipset with quad-band simultaneous radio and 5-7GHz/320MHz support
The BCM4398 is a low-power, highly integrated Wi-Fi 7 and Bluetooth 5.2 combo chip optimized for mobile handset applications :where high performance, low latency, low power consumption and small solution size are key requirements.
The BCM4398 system-on-a-chip contains a simultaneous dual-band (SDB) 2×2 802.11be-compliant radio, a dual-core :Bluetooth (BT) 5.2 radio, and a dedicated scan core that enhances Bluetooth and WLAN system operation. The device includes support for 320MHz wide channels, 5-7GHz band support and 4K-QAM modulation.
*Features :802.11be compliant, full 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ax legacy compatibility :20/40/80/160/320MHz channels for the 2×2 5GHz and 6GHz radio, :and 20MHz channels for the 2×2 2.4GHz radio :Simultaneous dual-band (SDB) mode support, PCIe Gen3 support :Scan radio enhances 2.4GHz, 5GHz, and 6GHz channel performance :Complies with BT Core Specification Version 5.2 with support :Dual-core Bluetooth support, Bluetooth Class 1 or 2 TX operation *Applications :Low-power mobile devices, AR/VR devices -->
